Helpful Links | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
Helpful Links | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Helpful Links If you are facing an emergency or need trusted information quickly, the links below can help.
            These services are provided by NSW and Australian government agencies and trusted organisations. If you are unsure where to start, begin with the emergency and language support options. Emergency and Immediate Help Emergency Use these services if you need urgent information or support during an emergency. NSW Government Emergencies Official emergency updates, safety advice, and contact information for New South Wales. Hazards Near Me NSW Local alerts and real-time information about fires, floods, storms, and other hazards near you. Language and Interpreter Support If English is not your first language, help is available. Translating and Interpreting Service (TIS National) Call 131 450 for free interpreter support, available 24 hours a day. You can ask for an interpreter in your language before explaining your situation. Legal and Government Information These services can help you understand your rights and options. Legal Aid NSW Free legal help, advice, and referrals across New South Wales. If you are not sure whether your issue is legal, they can help you work that out. Weather, Roads and Transport Use these services to stay informed about conditions that may affect your safety or travel. Bureau of Meteorology Weather forecasts, warnings, and flood updates for your area. Live Traffic NSW Current road conditions, closures, and traffic updates across NSW. Need help choosing the right service? If you are unsure which service is best for your situation, Mosaic can help. Our team can listen, explain your options, and support you to connect with the right help. Contact Mosaic Last updated: {new Date().toLocaleDateString()} react-helmet-async @/components/RelatedServices @/components/ui/button @/components/ui/card @/components/ui/badge react-router-dom items.body:
{
  return ( Donate | Mosaic Multicultural Connections {/* Hero */} Donate to Mosaic Your contribution directly supports multicultural communities throughout New South Wales. Your Impact We need your help to deliver the important programs and activities that you can find throughout our website. By donating to Mosaic Multicultural Connections, you will be making a positive difference to the lives of individuals, families and communities. Mosaic Multicultural Connections is a registered business name of Northern Settlement Services Limited and is a registered charity with the ACNC. We can provide tax deductible receipts for gifts over $2.00 ABN 72 002 898 759 Secure payments processed by Raisely. react @/components/RelatedServices react-helmet-async animate-fade-in description Support Mosaic Multicultural Connections. items.title: Volunteer in Newcastle | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
s.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-').replace(/(^-|-$)/g, ''); const short = (s: string) = (s.length 220 ? s.slice(0, 220) + '…' : s); const settlementRoles = [ { title: 'English Literacy & Conversation Tutor', blurb: "Help someone find their voice in a new language. You'll meet weekly for one to two hours with clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—building conversational confidence and literacy skills through formal coursework, everyday practice, and creative learning tools. If you have teaching or tutoring experience, genuine patience, and you understand that language learning is about belonging and possibility as much as grammar, this role offers the chance to watch people discover their capabilities week by week.", }, { title: 'Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor', blurb: "Be part of someone's journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You'll work one-on-one preparing clients for their citizenship test, using government resources and Mosaic materials to break down complex concepts and support English comprehension at the right pace. If you have knowledge of the citizenship test process, enjoy tutoring, and understand that this milestone represents years of hope and hard work, this five-month commitment could be your perfect match.", }, { title: 'Homework & Learning Centre Tutor', blurb: "Help recently-arrived young people overcome educational disadvantage and discover their academic potential. You'll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you're committed to showing up consistently because these students need that reliability, this role offers enormous rewards for a two-term commitment.", }, { title: 'Employment Mentor', blurb: "Help someone rebuild their career in a new country. Meeting at our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; const agedCareRoles = [ { title: 'Aged Care Facility Visitor', blurb: "Bring companionship and joy to an older person living in residential care. You'll visit a designated resident at least twice monthly, building a genuine friendship through conversation, shared activities, and consistent presence that brightens their days and enriches both your lives. If you have genuine empathy for older people, demonstrated reliability, excellent listening skills, and the commitment to maintain appropriate boundaries while building a friendship that matters, this role offers profound rewards beyond volunteering.", }, { title: 'Aged Care Home Visitor', blurb: "Provide companionship and social connection for older people living independently in their own homes. You'll visit an aged care recipient at least twice monthly, helping combat isolation while respecting their independence and dignity in their own environment. If you combine reliability with respectful sensitivity, can work independently while knowing when to seek guidance, and you understand that aging at home is about preserving independence and identity, this role allows you to make an enormous difference in someone's daily life.", }, ]; const marketingRoles = [ { title: 'Marketing Administration Support', blurb: "This is the backbone work that keeps everything running smoothly. You'll maintain our digital files so we can actually find things when we need them. You'll update marketing calendars so everyone knows what's coming. You'll proofread internal communications and keep our content library organised and accessible. If you're someone who finds genuine satisfaction in creating order from chaos, who appreciates the quiet power of good systems, and who excels at detailed work that makes other people's jobs easier, this role might be your perfect fit.", }, { title: 'Social Media Marketing Support', blurb: "Help us build meaningful connections in the digital spaces where people increasingly look for information and community. You'll schedule posts, track what's resonating with audiences, create simple graphics using templates we provide, and keep our social media presence consistent and engaging. If you're someone who genuinely enjoys social media, understands how different platforms work, and wants to use those skills to amplify diverse voices across generations and challenge stereotypes, this could be exactly what you're looking for.", }, { title: 'Graphic Design Support', blurb: "Bring our mission to life visually. You'll design graphics for internal materials, create social media content, adapt templates for different purposes, and help maintain our vibrant, inclusive brand aesthetic. If you're creative, if you have design skills you want to develop or share, if you care about how visual communication can either reinforce or challenge harmful narratives about ageing and diversity, and if you want work in your portfolio that actually means something, this role offers all of that.", }, { title: 'Photography and Videography Support', blurb: "Capture the full humanity of our communities through culturally sensitive, empowering visual storytelling. You'll document events, workshops, home care activities, and settlement programs in ways that reflect warmth, resilience, joy, and dignity. If you're a photographer or videographer who believes in the power of images to shift narratives, who approaches your craft with respect and cultural humility, and who wants to use your skills for genuine social impact, we'd love to work with you.", }, ]; return ( Volunteer in Newcastle | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Newcastle Volunteering Make a Local Impact in Newcastle Volunteer with Mosaic to support families in Newcastle through tutoring, mentoring and community connection. If you combine reliability with respectful sensitivity, can work independently while knowing when to seek guidance, and you understand that aging at home is about preserving independence and identity, this role allows you to make an enormous difference in someone Marketing Administration Support ll maintain our digital files so we can actually find things when we need them. You re someone who finds genuine satisfaction in creating order from chaos, who appreciates the quiet power of good systems, and who excels at detailed work that makes other people Social Media Marketing Support ll schedule posts, track what re someone who genuinely enjoys social media, understands how different platforms work, and wants to use those skills to amplify diverse voices across generations and challenge stereotypes, this could be exactly what you Graphic Design Support ll design graphics for internal materials, create social media content, adapt templates for different purposes, and help maintain our vibrant, inclusive brand aesthetic. If you Photography and Videography Support ll document events, workshops, home care activities, and settlement programs in ways that reflect warmth, resilience, joy, and dignity. If you , }, ]; return (

You'll meet weekly for one to two hours with clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—building conversational confidence and literacy skills through formal coursework, everyday practice, and creative learning tools. If you have teaching or tutoring experience, genuine patience, and you understand that language learning is about belonging and possibility as much as grammar, this role offers the chance to watch people discover their capabilities week by week.", }, { title: 'Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor', blurb: "Be part of someone's journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You'll work one-on-one preparing clients for their citizenship test, using government resources and Mosaic materials to break down complex concepts and support English comprehension at the right pace. If you have knowledge of the citizenship test process, enjoy tutoring, and understand that this milestone represents years of hope and hard work, this five-month commitment could be your perfect match.", }, { title: 'Homework & Learning Centre Tutor', blurb: "Help recently-arrived young people overcome educational disadvantage and discover their academic potential. You'll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you're committed to showing up consistently because these students need that reliability, this role offers enormous rewards for a two-term commitment.", }, { title: 'Employment Mentor', blurb: "Help someone rebuild their career in a new country. Meeting at our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; const agedCareRoles = [ { title: 'Aged Care Facility Visitor', blurb: "Bring companionship and joy to an older person living in residential care. You'll visit a designated resident at least twice monthly, building a genuine friendship through conversation, shared activities, and consistent presence that brightens their days and enriches both your lives. If you have genuine empathy for older people, demonstrated reliability, excellent listening skills, and the commitment to maintain appropriate boundaries while building a friendship that matters, this role offers profound rewards beyond volunteering.", }, { title: 'Aged Care Home Visitor', blurb: "Provide companionship and social connection for older people living independently in their own homes. You'll visit an aged care recipient at least twice monthly, helping combat isolation while respecting their independence and dignity in their own environment. If you combine reliability with respectful sensitivity, can work independently while knowing when to seek guidance, and you understand that aging at home is about preserving independence and identity, this role allows you to make an enormous difference in someone's daily life.", }, ]; const marketingRoles = [ { title: 'Marketing Administration Support', blurb: "This is the backbone work that keeps everything running smoothly. You'll maintain our digital files so we can actually find things when we need them. You'll update marketing calendars so everyone knows what's coming. You'll proofread internal communications and keep our content library organised and accessible. If you're someone who finds genuine satisfaction in creating order from chaos, who appreciates the quiet power of good systems, and who excels at detailed work that makes other people's jobs easier, this role might be your perfect fit.", }, { title: 'Social Media Marketing Support', blurb: "Help us build meaningful connections in the digital spaces where people increasingly look for information and community. You'll schedule posts, track what's resonating with audiences, create simple graphics using templates we provide, and keep our social media presence consistent and engaging. If you're someone who genuinely enjoys social media, understands how different platforms work, and wants to use those skills to amplify diverse voices across generations and challenge stereotypes, this could be exactly what you're looking for.", }, { title: 'Graphic Design Support', blurb: "Bring our mission to life visually. You'll design graphics for internal materials, create social media content, adapt templates for different purposes, and help maintain our vibrant, inclusive brand aesthetic. You'll visit an aged care recipient at least twice monthly, helping combat isolation while respecting their independence and dignity in their own environment. If you combine reliability with respectful sensitivity, can work independently while knowing when to seek guidance, and you understand that aging at home is about preserving independence and identity, this role allows you to make an enormous difference in someone's daily life.", }, ]; const marketingRoles = [ { title: 'Marketing Administration Support', blurb: "This is the backbone work that keeps everything running smoothly. You'll maintain our digital files so we can actually find things when we need them. You'll update marketing calendars so everyone knows what's coming. You'll proofread internal communications and keep our content library organised and accessible. If you're someone who finds genuine satisfaction in creating order from chaos, who appreciates the quiet power of good systems, and who excels at detailed work that makes other people's jobs easier, this role might be your perfect fit.", }, { title: 'Social Media Marketing Support', blurb: "Help us build meaningful connections in the digital spaces where people increasingly look for information and community. You'll schedule posts, track what's resonating with audiences, create simple graphics using templates we provide, and keep our social media presence consistent and engaging. If you're someone who genuinely enjoys social media, understands how different platforms work, and wants to use those skills to amplify diverse voices across generations and challenge stereotypes, this could be exactly what you're looking for.", }, { title: 'Graphic Design Support', blurb: "Bring our mission to life visually. You'll design graphics for internal materials, create social media content, adapt templates for different purposes, and help maintain our vibrant, inclusive brand aesthetic. If you're creative, if you have design skills you want to develop or share, if you care about how visual communication can either reinforce or challenge harmful narratives about ageing and diversity, and if you want work in your portfolio that actually means something, this role offers all of that.", }, { title: 'Photography and Videography Support', blurb: "Capture the full humanity of our communities through culturally sensitive, empowering visual storytelling. You'll document events, workshops, home care activities, and settlement programs in ways that reflect warmth, resilience, joy, and dignity. If you're a photographer or videographer who believes in the power of images to shift narratives, who approaches your craft with respect and cultural humility, and who wants to use your skills for genuine social impact, we'd love to work with you.", }, ]; return ( Volunteer in Newcastle | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Newcastle Volunteering Make a Local Impact in Newcastle Volunteer with Mosaic to support families in Newcastle through tutoring, mentoring and community connection. s.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-').replace(/(^-|-$)/g, ''); const short = (s: string) = (s.length 220 ? s.slice(0, 220) + '…' : s); const settlementRoles = [ { title: 'English Literacy & Conversation Tutor', blurb: "Help someone find their voice in a new language. You'll meet weekly for one to two hours with clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—building conversational confidence and literacy skills through formal coursework, everyday practice, and creative learning tools. If you have teaching or tutoring experience, genuine patience, and you understand that language learning is about belonging and possibility as much as grammar, this role offers the chance to watch people discover their capabilities week by week.", }, { title: 'Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor', blurb: "Be part of someone's journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You'll work one-on-one preparing clients for their citizenship test, using government resources and Mosaic materials to break down complex concepts and support English comprehension at the right pace. If you have knowledge of the citizenship test process, enjoy tutoring, and understand that this milestone represents years of hope and hard work, this five-month commitment could be your perfect match.", }, { title: 'Homework & Learning Centre Tutor', blurb: "Help recently-arrived young people overcome educational disadvantage and discover their academic potential. You'll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you're committed to showing up consistently because these students need that reliability, this role offers enormous rewards for a two-term commitment.", }, { title: 'Employment Mentor', blurb: "Help someone rebuild their career in a new country. Meeting at our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our Charlestown office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; const agedCareRoles = [ { title: 'Aged Care Facility Visitor', blurb: "Bring companionship and joy to an older person living in residential care. items.title: Volunteer in Armidale | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
s.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-').replace(/(^-|-$)/g, ''); const short = (s: string) = (s.length 220 ? s.slice(0, 220) + '…' : s); const settlementRoles = [ { title: 'English Literacy & Conversation Tutor', blurb: "Help someone find their voice in a new language. You'll meet weekly for one to two hours with clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—building conversational confidence and literacy skills through formal coursework, everyday practice, and creative learning tools. If you have teaching or tutoring experience, genuine patience, and you understand that language learning is about belonging and possibility as much as grammar, this role offers the chance to watch people discover their capabilities week by week.", }, { title: 'Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor', blurb: "Be part of someone's journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You'll work one-on-one preparing clients for their citizenship test, using government resources and Mosaic materials to break down complex concepts and support English comprehension at the right pace. If you have knowledge of the citizenship test process, enjoy tutoring, and understand that this milestone represents years of hope and hard work, this five-month commitment could be your perfect match.", }, { title: 'Homework & Learning Centre Tutor', blurb: "Help recently-arrived young people overcome educational disadvantage and discover their academic potential. You'll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you're committed to showing up consistently because these students need that reliability, this role offers enormous rewards for a two-term commitment.", }, { title: 'Employment Mentor', blurb: "Help someone rebuild their career in a new country. Meeting at our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; return ( Volunteer in Armidale | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Armidale Volunteering Support Families in Armidale Volunteer with Mosaic in Armidale to strengthen local multicultural communities with practical care. You Homework & Learning Centre Tutor ll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you Employment Mentor Housing Mentor , }, ]; return (

items.title: Volunteer in Armidale | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
s.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9]+/g, '-').replace(/(^-|-$)/g, ''); const short = (s: string) = (s.length 220 ? s.slice(0, 220) + '…' : s); const settlementRoles = [ { title: 'English Literacy & Conversation Tutor', blurb: "Help someone find their voice in a new language. You'll meet weekly for one to two hours with clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—building conversational confidence and literacy skills through formal coursework, everyday practice, and creative learning tools. If you have teaching or tutoring experience, genuine patience, and you understand that language learning is about belonging and possibility as much as grammar, this role offers the chance to watch people discover their capabilities week by week.", }, { title: 'Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor', blurb: "Be part of someone's journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You'll work one-on-one preparing clients for their citizenship test, using government resources and Mosaic materials to break down complex concepts and support English comprehension at the right pace. If you have knowledge of the citizenship test process, enjoy tutoring, and understand that this milestone represents years of hope and hard work, this five-month commitment could be your perfect match.", }, { title: 'Homework & Learning Centre Tutor', blurb: "Help recently-arrived young people overcome educational disadvantage and discover their academic potential. You'll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you're committed to showing up consistently because these students need that reliability, this role offers enormous rewards for a two-term commitment.", }, { title: 'Employment Mentor', blurb: "Help someone rebuild their career in a new country. Meeting at our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; return ( Volunteer in Armidale | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Armidale Volunteering Support Families in Armidale Volunteer with Mosaic in Armidale to strengthen local multicultural communities with practical care. Settlement Support {settlementRoles.map((r) = ( {r.title} {r.blurb} Download PD Apply {short(r.blurb)} Apply to Volunteer More Ways to Get Involved react-helmet-async @/components/ui/VolunteerLocationNav react-router-dom @/components/ui/Section @/components/ui/GlassCard lucide-react @radix-ui/react-dialog @radix-ui/react-tabs ); const short = (s: string) => (s.length > 220 ? s.slice(0, 220) + : s); const settlementRoles = [ { title: Citizenship Test Preparation Tutor s journey to calling Australia home in the fullest sense. You Homework & Learning Centre Tutor ll volunteer at a school venue for 90 minutes weekly, supporting refugee and migrant students with English skills, homework, and academic confidence through fun learning activities (primary) or one-on-one tutoring (secondary). If you have strong English proficiency, enjoy working with young people, and you Employment Mentor Housing Mentor , }, ]; return (

Meeting at our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients—mainly from refugee backgrounds—with resume writing, interview practice, job search skills, and navigating Australian employment pathways, working alongside caseworkers to provide comprehensive support. If you understand job search processes, have strong computer skills, and you recognize that employment is about rebuilding identity and independence after displacement, this three-month minimum commitment offers the chance to change trajectories.", }, { title: 'Housing Mentor', blurb: "Help families find a place to call home. Working from our local office for at least two hours weekly or fortnightly, you'll support clients in searching for properties, liaising with real estate agents, preparing rental applications, and building comprehensive housing resource lists. If you understand how the rental market works, have strong communication skills for dealing with housing professionals, and you recognize that housing is the foundation for everything else in a new life, this three-month minimum commitment lets you provide something essential.", }, ]; return ( Volunteer in Armidale | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Armidale Volunteering Support Families in Armidale Volunteer with Mosaic in Armidale to strengthen local multicultural communities with practical care. items.title: Mosaic Code of Conduct Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
Mosaic Code of Conduct Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Code of Conduct Policy Mosaic Multicultural Connections expects all staff, volunteers, contractors and partners to act with
            respect, integrity and care. This policy outlines acceptable behaviour and how concerns can be raised. {/* Our values */} Our Values We embed these values in our decisions and day‑to‑day behaviour: Respect — Treat everyone with dignity, courtesy and cultural sensitivity. Integrity — Be honest and transparent; declare conflicts of interest. Safety — Prioritise physical, psychological and cultural safety. Inclusion — Champion diversity and equitable access to services. Accountability — Take responsibility for actions and outcomes. {/* Expected behaviours */} Expected Behaviours Act professionally and courteously with clients, colleagues and partners. Follow Mosaic policies, procedures and lawful directions. Protect confidential information and people’s privacy. Use Mosaic resources responsibly and for authorised purposes. Report hazards, risks, misconduct or suspected breaches promptly. {/* Unacceptable behaviours */} Unacceptable Behaviours Bullying, harassment, discrimination or vilification. Violence, threats, stalking or unsafe conduct. Fraud, corruption, theft or misuse of funds/resources. Sharing confidential information without authorisation. Alcohol or drug impairment while performing duties. {/* Conflicts, gifts & resources */} Conflicts of Interest, Gifts & Resources Declare actual, perceived or potential conflicts to your manager. Do not accept gifts/benefits that may influence decisions; record any offered gifts in line with policy. Use Mosaic assets (e.g. devices, vehicles, systems) for approved purposes only. {/* Reporting & support */} Reporting Concerns & Getting Support If you witness or experience misconduct, raise it early. You will be treated with respect and concerns will
              be handled confidentially wherever possible. Speak with your manager or HR representative. Use our confidential process — see the Whistleblower Policy For safety matters, refer to the Work Health & Safety Policy For inclusion concerns, see the Diversity & Inclusion Policy You can also contact us via the Contact page If you or someone else is in immediate danger, call {/* Consequences */} Consequences of Breach Breaches of this Code may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment or
              cessation of engagement. Criminal behaviour will be referred to relevant authorities. {/* Review */} Policy Review This policy is reviewed regularly to ensure it remains current and effective. This page summarises Mosaic’s Code of Conduct. For detailed procedures, speak with HR. Download full policy (PDF) react-helmet-async react-router-dom lucide-react min-h-screen bg-background description Standards of behaviour that reflect Mosaic’s values of respect, integrity, safety and inclusion for staff, volunteers and partners. mx-auto max-w-5xl px-6 py-16 mb-8 text-center text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold tracking-tight mt-3 text-muted-foreground max-w-2xl mx-auto grid gap-6 rounded-xl border bg-card p-6 shadow-sm flex items-center gap-3 h-6 w-6 text-primary text-xl font-semibold mt-2 text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-4 list-disc list-inside space-y-1 text-sm font-medium mt-3 list-disc list-inside space-y-1 text-sm text-primary hover:underline /policies/whistleblower /policies/work-health-safety /policies/diversity-inclusion /contact mt-4 flex items-start gap-2 text-xs text-muted-foreground h-4 w-4 tel:000 mt-8 text-xs text-muted-foreground mt-6 https://mosaicmc.org.au/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/Mosaic-Code-of-Conduct.pdf _blank noopener noreferrer inline-flex items-center gap-2 rounded-lg border bg-card px-4 py-2 text-sm shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition

items.title: Mosaic Diversity & Inclusion Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
Mosaic Diversity & Inclusion Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Diversity & Inclusion Policy Mosaic celebrates diversity and fosters inclusion. This summary outlines our commitment, responsibilities, and
            how to raise concerns. {/* Commitment */} Our Commitment Promote equitable access and culturally safe services. Eliminate discriminatory practices and systemic barriers. Support diverse identities across staff, volunteers and clients. {/* Principles */} Principles Respect, dignity and inclusion guide all interactions. Accessibility and language support are prioritised. Zero tolerance for discrimination and harassment. {/* Responsibilities & Reporting */} Responsibilities & Reporting Everyone shares responsibility for inclusion. If you experience or witness exclusionary behaviour or
              discrimination, report it promptly. Speak with your manager or HR in the first instance. Use our formal reporting process for serious concerns. Protection from retaliation is provided under relevant policies. If you or someone else is in immediate danger, call {/* Review */} Policy Review This policy is reviewed regularly to ensure it remains current and effective. This page summarises Mosaic’s Diversity & Inclusion Policy. For detailed procedures, speak with HR. items.title: Mosaic Whistleblower Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body: Mosaic Whistleblower Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Whistleblower Policy Guidance for reporting misconduct, ensuring confidentiality, and protections against retaliation. {/* What is Reportable */} Reportable Concerns Fraud, corruption, or serious misconduct. Risks to health, safety, or the public. Breach of law or Mosaic policies. {/* Protections */} Protections Confidential reporting channels and anonymity options. No retaliation for good-faith reports. Support available throughout the process. {/* Investigation */} Investigation Process Prompt assessment of reports and triage. Evidence-based investigation respecting confidentiality. Findings inform corrective actions and improvements. If you or someone else is in immediate danger, call This page summarises Mosaic’s Whistleblower Policy. For confidential advice, contact HR. items.title: Mosaic Quality Management Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
Mosaic Quality Management Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Quality Management Policy Our commitment to safe, effective, and culturally responsive services through quality assurance and
            continuous improvement. {/* Standards & Framework */} Standards & Framework Alignment to relevant national standards and Mosaic policies. Documented procedures support consistent, safe delivery. {/* Assurance & Monitoring */} Assurance & Monitoring Regular audits, feedback collection and incident review. Corrective actions tracked to resolution. {/* Continuous Improvement */} Continuous Improvement Data-informed changes and periodic policy reviews. Staff training maintains competence and cultural safety. If you or someone else is in immediate danger, call This page summarises Mosaic’s Quality Management Policy. For detailed procedures, contact the Quality team. items.title: Mosaic Work Health and Safety Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections
items.body:
Mosaic Work Health and Safety Policy | Mosaic Multicultural Connections Work Health & Safety Policy Mosaic is committed to providing a safe, healthy and inclusive environment. This summary outlines key
            responsibilities, how to report hazards and incidents, and emergency procedures. {/* Safety responsibilities */} Responsibilities Follow WHS procedures and lawful directions at all times. Use equipment safely and report faults or hazards promptly. Participate in training and emergency drills when scheduled. Support psychological safety and respectful behaviour across teams. {/* Hazard identification & risk management */} Hazards & Risk Management Identify hazards (physical, environmental, psychosocial) and reduce risk. Escalate high-risk issues to your manager immediately. Document controls and review effectiveness regularly. Wear appropriate PPE where required and maintain good housekeeping. {/* Incident reporting & response */} Incident Reporting & Response Report incidents, near misses and injuries as soon as possible. Seek first aid or medical support if
              needed and notify your manager. Record incidents using Mosaic’s reporting process and forms. Cooperate with investigations and corrective actions. Respect confidentiality and privacy of individuals involved. If anyone is in immediate danger, call {/* Training & PPE */} Training & PPE Complete induction and role-specific WHS training modules. Use, store and maintain PPE correctly; replace damaged items. Know the location of first aid kits, fire extinguishers and exits. {/* Emergency procedures */} Emergency Procedures Follow evacuation procedures and instructions from wardens. Assist clients or visitors who may need help exiting safely. Report post-incident observations to improve future responses. {/* Review */} Policy Review This policy is reviewed regularly to ensure it remains current and effective. This page summarises Mosaic’s Work Health & Safety Policy. For detailed procedures, speak with HR. Escalate high-risk issues to your manager immediately. Document controls and review effectiveness regularly. Wear appropriate PPE where required and maintain good housekeeping. {/* Incident reporting & response */} Incident Reporting & Response Report incidents, near misses and injuries as soon as possible. Seek first aid or medical support if
              needed and notify your manager. Record incidents using Mosaic’s reporting process and forms. Cooperate with investigations and corrective actions. Respect confidentiality and privacy of individuals involved. If anyone is in immediate danger, call {/* Training & PPE */} Training & PPE Complete induction and role-specific WHS training modules. Use, store and maintain PPE correctly; replace damaged items. Know the location of first aid kits, fire extinguishers and exits. {/* Emergency procedures */} Emergency Procedures Follow evacuation procedures and instructions from wardens. Assist clients or visitors who may need help exiting safely. Report post-incident observations to improve future responses. {/* Review */} Policy Review This policy is reviewed regularly to ensure it remains current and effective.
